DOC.brief_summary: Vitamin D treatment primary dysmenorrhoea . Design : Randomised controlled trial . Setting : In university hospital . Population : 142 woman age 16-35 year . Methods : Patients treat 667 unit vitamin D day , 200 unit vitamin E day 400 mg ibuprofen twice day,2 day date menstruation continue first 3 day , 2 month . Main outcome measure : Pain score . Results : Mean VAS vitamin D group 4,91 , 6,54 vitamin E group 4,02 ibuprofen group Conclusion : Vitamin D vitamin E effective relieving pain , effect vitamin D prominent
DOC.detailed_description: An excessive uterine production prostaglandins pathogenic trigger dysmenorrhoea . Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug ( NSAIDs ) currently accept drug management disorder . The capacity synthesize vitamin D presence vitamin D receptor human cycling endometrium also demonstrate . Because vitamin D reduce synthesis prostaglandin , beneficial effect vitamin D uterus possible.Vitamin E inhibit release arachidonic acid conversion arachidonic acid prostaglandin via action enzyme phospholipase A2 cyclooxygenase .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Women regular menstrual cycle last 21 35 day , menstruation last 3 7 day ; 2 . Women good health take medication include calcium , magnesium , vitamin D oral contraceptive . 3 . Women previous history gynaecological disease , normal pelvic examination eligible . 1 ) Previous current use intrauterine contraceptive device within 6 month enrollment permit
